column4: I'm trying to build a home NAS - can Ubuntu server go into suspend mode, or only Ubuntu desktop?
you can suspend ubuntu server, however why not use the desktop, it makes a great server OS

I suppose. I don't know a lot about Ubuntu, trying to figure out how to do it all! I'll be using a 4gb USB as OS-drive and 2x1TB drives in software RAID, serving files on the network, making backups and downloading torrents
the desktop OS will be fine, I assure you, plus it will be easier for you to learn while you set it up
putting your OS on a USB disk may not be the best move, try to use an internal bus drive
thanks for the tip! why not a USB drive, by the way?
slower interface
so your core OS would be on the slowest interface
well, I'll be using 2 S-ATA drives for the backup and file sharing, which is the essential part. Would that be affected by the USB performance (if the OS is on USB drive)?
yes
there are many VERY quiet drives on the market, you don't need solid state
actually I realize now that the MB I bought only has 2 S-ATA. Would it be stupid to put the OS on my mirrored 2x1TB disks?
that would be fine, and very resillient, good idea
In that case though, would I need to have hardware RAID, or could it be done via Ubuntu somehow? I don't think my motherboard has RAID built in
software raid is very very good
so I can install it on one of the drives first, and then have Ubuntu copy that disk to the other?
linux (ubuntu) comes with software raid, if you use the alternative install CD you can install to software raid (mirrored)
it works very very well
OK I see. If I put the OS on this mirrored set of drives - would they constantly have to be spinning? Or at least, spin up as soon as the OS needs to read to/from a file?
correct (I forgot you wanted to hibernate)
are you still around?
